thig6.1:0.3: Verses of the Five Hundred Elders
thig6.1:2.4: for you would understand that this is the nature of a being.
thig6.1:4.1: One who has died in the form of a human being,
thig6.1:4.2: will be reborn again and again.
thig6.1:4.3: As one comes, so one goes;
thig6.1:4.4: why lament since that is so?”
thig6.1:5.1: “At last, you pulled out the thorn,
thig6.1:5.2: difficult to see, stuck in my heart.
thig6.1:5.3: I was overcome with grief after the loss of my child,
thig6.1:5.4: but now that grief has been dispelled.
thig6.1:6.1: Today the thorn has been pulled out,
thig6.1:6.2: I am free of craving, fully quenched.
thig6.1:6.3: I go to the Sage for refuge
thig6.1:6.4: in the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha.”
thig6.1:7.1: In this way Five Hundred Elder Bhikkhunīs spoke…
